sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Friday, the 3rd of December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A very warm welcome to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As Omicron continues to spread, governments up their efforts to get people vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Germany says it could make Covid jabs mandatory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Germany's armed forces pay tribute to outgoing Chancellor Angela Merkel, with a military band playing her choice of communist-era punk rock.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And Euronews sits down with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken in Stockholm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: As he warns Russia, actions have consequences. AN OUTBREAK OF 50 PEOPLE INFECTED WITH THE OMICRON VARIANT OF COVID-19 AFTER 120 PEOPLE GATHERED FOR A PARTY IN NORWAY APPEARS TO CONFIRM THAT THIS VARIANT WILL OVERTAKE DELTA AS THE DOMINANT STRAIN IN EUROPE, AS THE EUROPEAN CENTER FOR DISEASE PREVENTION AND CONTROL BELIEVES.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: SCIENTISTS ARE STILL STUDYING THE OMICRON VARIANT, PARTICULARLY HOPING TO UNDERSTAND for Disease Prevention and Control believes. Scientists are still studying the Omicron variant, particularly hoping to understand if current vaccines are effective against it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: This variant is even more mutations than Delta had, so we have to keep a close eye on it to understand if this illness is more serious or milder than before. We do not know, and also if vaccines will still work well on this variant. Most European governments insist that the only way to stop the pandemic is to increase vaccination rates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In Germany, a hospital in Bavaria is hoping to raise awareness by switching on red lights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Chancellor Angela Merkel and her successor Olaf Scholz have agreed that unvaccinated people will be excluded from non-essential stores, cultural and recreational venues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The Bundestag is also considering a general vaccine mandate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In the UK, Boris Johnson is hoping to set an example by getting the booster jab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But Johnson said governments shouldn't overreact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The most important thing is that people should follow the guidance we've set out and people shouldn't be cancelling things and there's no need for that at all. That's not what we're saying. What we're doing is trying to respond in a balanced and a proportionate way to the arrival on the other a new variant on the table, governments around Europe are waiting with restrictions to apply ahead of Christmas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Europe's residents are starting to feel the fatigue of restrictions and the general lockdown seems difficult to justify politically for most countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: More vaccinations, more testing and more restrictions for travelers to the U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As the new Omicron variant of COVID-19 advances, Joe Biden is preparing the country for winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Travelers from abroad will be required to present a negative test done 24 hours prior to arrival, regardless of their vaccination status.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The president plans to increase vaccinations and booster jabs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: It's a plan that I think should unite us. I know COVID-19 has been very divisive in this country, it's become a political issue, which is a sad, sad commentary. It shouldn't be, but it has been.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Now as we move into the winter and face the challenges of this new variant, this is a moment we can put the divisives behind us, new variant, this is a moment we can put the devices behind us, I hope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: This is a moment we can do what we haven't been able to do enough of through this whole pandemic, get the nation to come together, unite the nation in a common purpose.

sentences.sentence: New York has already detected several cases of the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But as the hours pass, many more states have identified Omicron variant. But as the hours pass, many more states have identified Omicron infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In the last few hours, Colorado and even Hawaii have reported Omicron infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Just days before she leaves office, German Chancellor Angela Merkel was given a traditional send-off at a military ceremony featuring a brass band playing her choice of music.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Merkel surprised observers by picking a communist era hit by the so-called godmother of punk, Nina Hagen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Merkel, who is caretaker chancellor until her successor Olaf Scholz is sworn in on Wednesday, explained that the song was a highlight of her youth while growing up in East Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Euronews journalist Kate Brady sent this report from Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: After 16 years in office, that was it on Thursday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Angela Merkel stepped away from the public eye until designated Chancellor Olaf Scholz from Germany's Social Democrats is sworn in this coming Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In the traditional gro√üe Zapfenstreich or Grand Tattoo, Merkel received her farewell military honours, and it's safe to say even Merkel, who's known for her poker face, was moved by the ceremony. A lot of attention had also been drawn to the songs Merkel had chosen, not least of all the 1974 East German hit Du hast den Farbfilm vergessen or you forgot the color film by punk icon Nina Hagen Which left many Germans wondering just how well they knew or know their outgoing Chancellor after all in her speech She described her time in office as full of events and often very challenging both politically and as a person At the same time she thanked the German people and called on them to approach life with a lightness of heart and be optimistic about the country's future, which is no easy feat right now as Germany confronts the worst wave of the pandemic that it's yet experienced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But less than a week from now, that responsibility will be in the hands of Olaf Scholz and his new government, marking the beginning of a new chapter in German and European history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Kate Brady, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Russia's Foreign Affairs Minister Sergey Lavrov met for talks in the sidelines of the annual Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe in Stockholm. 57 members were at the summit to discuss key regional security. It follows fears of an impending invasion after a buildup of Russian military along the East Ukrainian border. Blinken warned Moscow to stay away from Ukraine. We call on Russia to respect Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity, to de-escalate, reverse the recent troop build-up, return forces to normal, peaceful positions, and to implement the Minsk commitments, especially the ceasefire provisions and those allowing OSCE monitors unfettered access.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian officials deny the accusations of aggression, but accuses Ukraine and Western backers of making up the claims to cover up their own allegedly aggressive designs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: NATO is turning down our proposals for the de-escalation of tensions and for stopping the possibility of dangerous incidents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: On the other hand, the military infrastructure of the alliance is getting irresponsibly closer to Russia's borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: The nightmare scenario of a military confrontation is returning after this well-known dual decision by NATO. Europe remains silent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Blinken says Washington is ready to support a diplomatic resolution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow is hoping for a meeting between President Vladimir Putin and US President Joe Biden soon amid the rising tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The sub-zero temperatures here in the Swedish capital Stockholm proved to be just as frosty as the relations between Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken when the pair met here for the start of a two-day summit of the OECD Ministerial Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At the very top of the agenda is the Russian troop buildup near the border with Ukraine, and Blinken reiterated Washington's unwavering support for Ukraine, telling Russia, warning Russia of any military movements on Ukraine saying there would be serious consequences urging Russia to pull back the troops and return to diplomacy now the pair met during a 30-minute meeting bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the summit and following this meeting Lavrov on his hand he warned of a return to a military confrontation a nightmare scenario Russia feels that NATO is getting too close to the Russian border and is telling NATO to basically don't expand as far east as the Russian border now both sides will return to their countries eventually and then report back to their presidents we do expect their meeting to take place between putin and biden today though is the second day of the summit now the swedish host is trying to get an agreement on climate change and conflict linking fighting climate change to preserving security in the region. Per Berg for Schneiberg, Euronews, Stockholm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Time for us to take a break now on Good Morning Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We'll be back in a few moments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Three, two, one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Merry Christmas! 30 years ago this week, President George W.H. Bush and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev declared an end to the Cold War, and the leaders spoke of hopes for a cooperative future together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But now tensions between the West and Russia are rising, with both accusing the other of aggressive military action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In an interview with Euronews, the U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken insisted Russia was putting infrastructure in place on the border with Ukraine to stage a rapid invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: ANTHONY BLINKEN, U.S. Secretary of State for Economic Cooperation and Development, We don't know President Putin's intent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: We don't know if he's made a decision to take renewed aggression against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: But what we do know is that he's putting in place the capacity to do so and to do so on short notice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And that's very, very concerning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And not just to us, it's concerning to many partners throughout Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: I was just at the NATO summit before coming here to the OSCE, and that concern is widespread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: What's most important for Russia to understand is that actions have consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Those consequences are real.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: They're not in Russia's interests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And having a conflict is in no one's interest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Let me just add this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: President Biden, when he spoke to President Putin in Geneva some months ago, said that our strong preference in the United States is to have a stable, predictable relationship with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Russia moving aggressively again against Ukraine would move in exactly the opposite direction of stable and predictable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: I don't think that's good for any of us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But the president was equally clear. If Russia chooses to act recklessly we'll Tech giant Meta says it has removed dozens of fake Facebook accounts that were fuelling tensions on the Polish-Belarusian border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Some of the accounts were linked directly to the Belarusian security service, the KGB.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Our social media correspondent Matthew Holroyd has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Meta, the big tech giant formerly known as Facebook, has now released its monthly adversarial threat report. This is where it details information about fake accounts and networks that it has removed from its platforms. In November, they said this included a number of Chinese accounts who had been posting deliberate disinformation about Covid-19 while posing as a fake Swiss biologist. It also included some French and Italian accounts that had been harassing journalists, doctors and elected professionals. But something else that Meta also focused on was deliberate inauthentic activity relating to the border between Poland and Belarus. For weeks now, hundreds of migrants have been trapped at the EU's external frontier amid a political standoff. And Meta says it now has evidence that fake accounts from both of these countries have been stoking tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In a report, Meta said that it had identified around 50 fake accounts and profiles on both Facebook and Instagram, all from Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: These accounts, they said, had posed as activists and journalists criticizing Warsaw and also sharing allegations that Polish border guards had violated migrants' rights. It said that all of these accounts were linked to the Belarusian State Security Committee, the KGB, and that some of them had even used artificial intelligence to generate fake photos for their profiles. These accounts were swiftly removed from Facebook and Instagram for violating their policies, the KGB yet to comment on the matter. But at the same time Meta said it had also removed a number of accounts based in Poland that had been posing as migrants, sharing made-up stories about how difficult it had been for them to enter the European Union, as well as some content related to neo-Nazi activity in Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Although Meta said there was no evidence of any state involvement, all of these accounts they said were based in Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So Marianne, this latest report just shows how, as we have seen throughout the broader crisis, both individuals in Poland and Belarus have been resorting to inauthentic online activity to try and stoke tensions at the EU's external border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: online activity to try and stoke tensions at the EU's external border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The recent collapse in Turkey's currency is having an impact beyond its borders. Northwest Syria, under rubber control, adopted the Turkish Lira in June 2020, as its own currency continued a disastrous downward spiral after a decade of conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: It was hoped the move would stabilize the region's ravaged economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: But since then, the lira in turn has lost 45% of its value.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: More than 20% was lost during last month alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We were optimistic that the Turkish lira was better than the Syrian currency because it was stable and there were many fluctuations in the Syrian currency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: Since the Turkish currency was adopted, it has fluctuated, as if we did not benefit at all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Turkish currency is not stable at the moment.

sentences.sentence: This negatively affected livelihood and trade, and now there is a vast stagnation in the region.

sentences.sentence: According to UNOCHA estimates, 97% of the population in the area are living in extreme poverty, which has made soaring prices even more problematic for both merchants and buyers.

sentences.sentence: We are confused.

sentences.sentence: Even though Turkish goods are what the Syrian markets are offering, the dollar is the currency for imports, and that's leading to market stagnation, according to analysts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: But it may take some time for theoretical economic solutions to benefit ordinary people, who are desperate for stability, just to supply basic necessities. Many are forced deeper and deeper into debt as the only means of survival.

sentences.sentence: Young and female, two traits many faces of their Friday for Future marches have in common.

Women in Europe have naturally embedded qualities that bring some say a touch of reasonableness or sensibility to the world and you know I think Europe would be rather lost without the patience, without the compassion, without the compromise we can bring to the table.
